Label smoothing as described in SpiceMix (https://doi.org/10.1038/s41588-022-01256-z). Implemented for numeric labels only

Source: R/clustering.R
SmoothLabels.Rd

Label smoothing as described in SpiceMix (https://doi.org/10.1038/s41588-022-01256-z). Implemented for numeric labels only

SmoothLabels(
  bank,
  cluster_names = NULL,
  k = 15L,
  prop_thres = 0.5,
  max_iter = 10,
  verbose = TRUE,
  include_self = TRUE
)

Arguments

bank

BanksyObject

cluster_names

(character) vector of label names to smooth. If NULL, smooths labels in clust.names(bank)

k

(integer) number of neighbors (default: 10)

prop_thres

(numeric) proportions threshold. If the fraction of neighbors with a certain label exceeds this proportion, change the label of the current sample (default: 0.5)

max_iter

(integer) max number of smoothing iterations. Set to -1 for smoothing to convergence. (default: 10)

verbose

(logical) verbosity

include_self

(logical) include the spots label in the neighborhood. (default: True)

Value

BanksyObject with smoothed cluster labels (appended with '_smooth') in meta.data

Examples

data(dlpfc151673)
bank = BanksyObject(
    own.expr = dlpfc151673$expression, 
    cell.locs = dlpfc151673$locations)
n_spots = ncol(own.expr(bank))
labels = readRDS(
    system.file('extdata/dlpfc_clusters.rds', package = 'Banksy')
    )[seq(n_spots)]
meta.data(bank)$clust = labels
bank = SmoothLabels(bank, k=6)
#> Iteration 1
#> Change: 129
#> Iteration 2
#> Change: 20
#> Iteration 3
#> Change: 3
#> Iteration 4
#> Change: 0
plotSpatialFeatures(bank, pt.size = 1, by = clust.names(bank), 
    type=rep('discrete',2), ncol = 2, main = clust.names(bank))
